title: Understand the given expressions
text:
First, identify the expression for calculating the change in enthalpy, ΔH, when the temperature changes at constant pressure. You can use the formula for a polyatomic gas:

ΔH $$=$$ $$n$$ · $$C_p$$ · ΔT.

Where:
ΔH is the change in enthalpy
$$n$$ is the number of moles
$$C_p$$ is the molar heat capacity at constant pressure
ΔT is the change in temperature

title: Evaluate given values
text:
List the known values from the problem statement:

- Number of moles, $$n$$ $$=$$ $$3.00$$
Molar heat capacity, $$C_p= rac{7}{2}$$ · R
Gas constant, R $$=$$ $$8.314$$ $$ rac{J}{mol}$$ · K
Change in temperature is given by the problem (assumed constant for this step)

Use these values to substitute into the formula.

title: Substitute and calculate
text:
Calculate the change in enthalpy using the formula and known values:

ΔH $$=$$ $$3.00$$ · (7/2 · $$8.314)$$ · ΔT

To complete the calculation, you need to multiply the coefficients and solve for ΔH.
